Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Pardaxin 4 (Pardaxin P-4, Pardaxin P4, Pa4, natural AMPs; flat fish, animals, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity:  Shai et al. demonstrated antibacterial activity in 1996. Active against E. coli, A. calcoaceticus, P. aeruginosa (25 uM), S. typhirnuriunz (40 uM), B. rnegateriurn, M. luteus, and B. subtilis (The MIC against other bacteria 3-13 uM).Chemical modification:  C-terminal amidation increased peptide activity.Animal model:cancer:mouse: The peptide showed efficacy against murine fibrosarcoma (Mar Drug 2012).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structure bound to DPC micellesherein the PDB.Updated 9/6/2012; 9/28/2012; 5/15/2013; 2/2014; 6/2019.GW.
Literature Information.Author: Shai Y, Fox J, Caratsch C, Shih YL, Edwards C, Lazarovici P.1988
Literature Information.Title: Sequencing and synthesis of pardaxin, a polypeptide from the Red Sea Moses sole with ionophore activity
